I am Ser Alberic Bale, knight of Ishgard in service to the Holy See.
What will you ask?
What do you do here?
What is a dragoon?
Nothing.

I am a knight of the Holy See, sworn for life─as we all are. In addition to my duties in service to the See, my fellow knights and I are tasked with protecting Ishgard from the dragons─the wyrms who have beset our nation throughout its history.

In the past this duty fell not to the knights of the See, but to a specialized brigade known as the dragoons. In my younger days, I was one of them─verily, their leader, bearing the title of Azure Dragoon.
Many years ago, I retired from active duty to serve the See. My former post is now held by my erstwhile student, an accomplished young dragoon by the name of Estinien.
The dragoons are an elite contingent of Ishgardian knights who serve to protect our nation from the wrath of the fearsome wyrms that would raze us to the ground.

The first─and greatest─of the dragoons was none other than Haldrath the Dragonseye, hero of the Founding Wars. It was he who drove back the great wyrm Nidhogg, claiming the powers of the Eye for Ishgard.

Dragoons must display complete mastery of their chosen weapon, the lance, that they might stand against their immense foe. The leader of the dragoons is known as the Azure Dragoon, and is chosen by the Eye, a relic guarded within the Holy See which bestows upon the chosen one the power of the dragon.

And yet this power is as a double-edged sword, for if the dragoon does not maintain absolute control over his emotions, he shall fall under the thrall of the very wyrms that he would slay. But so it always has been─no great power comes without a cost.

With Estinien having left us, the post of the Azure Dragoon has been vacated for the first time in the See's recorded history.
If I said that the current state of affairs did not put me ill at ease, I would be a liar.
And yet, I am but a lone dragoon, and it is not my place to question. And so I place my trust in my superiors, and defend the See with my life.
Right glad was I to learn that Estinien has regained mastery over the dragon within.
Unfortunately, he cannot rejoin his fellow dragoons. He has duties of his own to fulfill, and will continue acting independently for the foreseeable future.

Even with Nidhogg slain, the hatred his scattered Horde bears towards us is undying. An attack may not come this day or the next, but it <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> come, and we must be unceasing in our vigilance.
Your slaying of Nidhogg's shade marked the end of the Dragonsong War.

There are of course members of the Horde that still harbor a fierce hatred in their hearts for the Holy See; some may even launch an assault upon us. However, their flame does not burn as bright as it once did.
We too have admittedly lost both Estinien and Heustienne, but the dragoons that remain grow in strength each day that passes. Ishgard need fear naught while we still draw breath.

We must also keep one eye on future generations. It is our duty to pass on both the traditions and techniques that have been born as a result of this thousand-year conflict; not to mention the truth behind it that you brought to light.

They ended as soon as you helped bring a conclusion to the Dragonsong war by dispatching Nidhogg's shade.
Estinien's decision to abandon both the Eyes and the mantle of Azure Dragoon truly epitomize this sudden change.
One would imagine we dragoons will need to follow Ser Aymeric's lead by adapting to these new times. Many hailed him an Azure Dragoon for a new age in the wake of the thousand-year war.
